description: The Department of Information Technology and e-Governance has received several awards for its e-Governance initiatives, including the E-Governance Initiative Award (2005), Silver Icon Award for Vahan (2006), CSI-e-Nilhant Award for Best e-Governance (2007), e-India 2008 Award for Exhibitor, Best e-Governance Award for Integrated Prison Management System (2008), The Manthan Award, Silver Icon for Best Content Management in National Portal Award (2010), Web Ratna Award (2009), National e-Governance Award – Financial Inclusion (CSC Banking Services) (2012), Silver Award for EBT through BC Model at Pragya Kendras, e-India 2013 for e-District, SKOCH Award for Emerging State Jharkhand 2013, SKOCH award for e-Kalyan, e-Nibandhan, Co-Operative, File Traker, IGF Award for e-Rahat 2014, SKOCH Award 2013 for e-Panchayat application, and World Bank Audit-Ease of Doing Business ranking (3rd). The department also highlighted budget allocations and expenditure for various schemes from 2013-14 to 2017-18. Several projects and initiatives were also mentioned, such as JAP-IT, JSAC, NIC, SeMT, e-Procurement, WAMIS, STPI, OFC connectivity, SMS Gateway, Skill Development, City Wi-Fi, IT/ITeS Policy, ESDM Policy, BPO/BPM Policy, Startup Policy, HkkjrusV project with BBNL, JharCert, LVkVZvi Hkspa j dSfiVy QaM with GVFL, and paperless initiatives.
funding_pattern: The department also highlighted budget allocations and expenditure for various schemes from 2013-14 to 2017-18.
title: Department of Information Technology and e-Governance Initiatives

description: The Central Sector Scheme ‘Mass Media Support to Agriculture Extension’ has been launched to revamp extension services using electronic media (Doordarshan and All India Radio) for technology and information transfer to farmers. The scheme aims to leverage TV and Radio's wide reach for extension at low cost. It utilizes Doordarshan and All India Radio's infrastructure to educate farmers on modern agricultural technologies and research. A 30-minute program airs 5-6 days/week on National, 18 Regional Kendras, and 180 Doordarshan transmitters. 96 Rural FM Radio Stations broadcast 30-minute programs 6 days/week. DAC produces films for Doordarshan's National Channel showcasing success stories, innovations, and farming practices, highlighting positive aspects of Indian agriculture. A 'Focused Advertisement Campaign' creates awareness of assistance schemes through 30-60 second audio/video spots on AIR, DD, and private channels during peak viewership.
title: Central Sector Scheme for ‘Mass Media Support to Agriculture Extension’
documents: You tube Link for krishidarshan Programmes
List of Narrowcasting & Regional Doordarshan Kendras and FM Kisan Vani Stations under the Schemes

description: The Marketing Research and Information Network (AGMARKNET) is a Central Sector Scheme launched in March 2000 to connect major agricultural markets across India with State Agricultural Marketing Boards and Directorates.  It aims to empower farmers with market information for production planning and optimal trading decisions. The scheme disseminates information on market requirements, export documentation, contract farming, and warehousing facilities, among others. It also provides training and extension services to farmers and market functionaries.  AGMARKNET is implemented by the Directorate of Marketing and Inspection (DMI) with technical support from the National Informatics Centre (NIC).
title: Marketing Research and Information Network (AGMARKNET)
INTEGRATED SCHEME FOR AGRICULTURAL MARKETING (only for testing, not for official use)

description: PROGRESS REPORT OF AMIGS SCHEME
funding_pattern: Subsidy through NABARD, NCDC, and State Agencies
title: AMIGS SCHEME

description: The scheme provides employment-oriented vocational training to workers. Key features include training aligned with the National Skill Qualification Framework (NSQF), partnership with Sector Skill Councils (SSCs), and a corpus fund for training costs. Eligible beneficiaries include construction workers registered with the Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board. Training programs cover various trades like Civil Work, Electrical Work, Plumbing, and Welding. The scheme aims to enhance employability through skill development and continuous candidate flow. It also includes monitoring of trained manpower data and employment status.

procedures.step_description: Candidates apply for training programs through the Construction Sector Skill Council.
Training is conducted by Construction Sector Skill Council.
Employment opportunities are facilitated through the Construction Sector Skill Council.

title: Employment Oriented Vocational Training
funding_pattern: The corpus involves contributions from various sources, including candidates, sponsors, and government programs. A 100% corpus utilization is targeted.

description: Skill development of human resources and placement of youth in the Construction Sector
title: MOU between Department of Industries, Jharkhand and Construction Industry Development Council (CIDC)
funding_pattern:
Rs.9000/- per candidate per month. The First Party shall release a one-time advance payment of 15% of the targeted work for the first year. For subsequent years, the fees shall be paid as follows:

For the first year:
1. 50% of the fees upon confirmed registration and verification.
2. 25% of the fees after one month of training.
3. 10% of the fees after training and employment of students.

For subsequent years:
1. 50% of the fees upon confirmed registration and verification.
2. 40% of the fees after one month of training.
3. 10% of the fees after training and employment of students.

description: The XII Five Year Plan (2012-2017) by the Jharkhand Department of Mines & Geology focuses on enhancing capacity for growth, skill development, and employment generation by increasing mineral production from 150 million tons to 200 million tons. Key thrust areas include mineral exploration (Iron ore, Bauxite, Limestone, Kyanite, Graphite, Soapstone, Manganese, Phosphorite, Dolomite, Mica, Quartzite, Quartz, and Coal), revenue collection, and mineral administration through e-governance and infrastructure development. Specific objectives involve geological investigations, remote sensing, and report publication for various minerals, along with transparent concession procedures, illegal mining checks, and human resource development. The Directorate of Geology will execute mineral exploration activities, while the Directorate of Mines will handle mineral administration and revenue collection.
title: XII Five Year Plan Proposal of Department of Mines & Geology

description: The Central Sector Scheme ‘Mass Media Support to Agriculture Extension’ has been launched to revamp extension services using electronic media (Doordarshan and All India Radio) for technology and information transfer to farmers. It utilizes the existing infrastructure of DD and AIR to educate farmers on modern technologies and research in agriculture and allied areas. A 30-minute program airs 5-6 days/week on National, 18 Regional Kendras, and 180 High/Low Power Transmitters of DD. 96 Rural FM Radio Stations of AIR broadcast 30-minute programs 6 days/week. DAC produces films for DD National's Saturday slot showcasing success stories, innovations, and farming practices.  A focused ad campaign creates awareness about assistance under various schemes via 30-60 second audio/video spots on AIR, DD, and private channels.
title: Central Sector Scheme for ‘Mass Media Support to Agriculture Extension’
documents: You tube Link for krishidarshan Programmes
List of Narrowcasting & Regional Doordarshan Kendras and FM Kisan Vani Stations under the Schemes

description: The Marketing Research and Information Network (AGMARKNET) aims to empower farmers through market information by establishing a nationwide network for speedy collection and dissemination of market information. It facilitates better price realization for farmers by providing information on market fees, charges, methods of sale, prices, arrivals, dispatches, marketing costs, infrastructure, standards, grades, labeling, sanitary and phyto-sanitary requirements, pledge finance, and new marketing opportunities. The scheme also sensitizes farmers to new challenges in agricultural marketing by using ICT, improves marketing efficiency through training and extension, and provides assistance for marketing research. It involves Directorate of Marketing and Inspection (DMI), National Informatics Centre (NIC), State Governments, and market committees.

procedures.step_description: State Agricultural Marketing Boards/Directorates identify markets and forward them to DMI for sanction.
Selected markets provide site for installation and operator.
Market committees collect data, feed it into the system, and transmit it.
NIC trains personnel at each node.
Incentives are paid for regular data reporting.
SAMB/State Department nominates a nodal officer to coordinate.
Proposals for CDs, Atlas, research, etc., are routed through DMI for funds.
Implementing agency furnishes an undertaking to maintain the system.

sponsors.sponsor_type: Ministry of Agriculture, Department of Agriculture and Cooperation

title: MARKETING RESEARCH AND INFORMATION NETWORK (AGMARKNET)
INTEGRATED SCHEME FOR AGRICULTURAL MARKETING (only for testing, not for official use)

description: Scheme for differently abled persons.
title: Financial assistance for the Differently Abled

criteria.description: 80% or more disability
Having 70 DB hearing loss in speech frequencies in both ears.
60 DB to 70 DB hearing loss in speech frequencies in both ears.
loss of sensation in hands or feet as well as loss of sensation and paresis in the eye and eye-lid but with no manifestdeformity.
manifest deformity and paresis but having sufficient mobility in their hands and feet to enable them to engage in normaleconomic activity
extreme physical deformity as well as advanced age which prevents him/her from undertaking any gainful occupation
total absence ofsight
visual acuity less than 3/60 or less than 10/200 (Snellen) in the better eye with best possible correction
limitation of the field of vision subtending an angle of less than 10 degree
visual acuity not exceeding 6/18 or less than 20/60 rpto 3 /60 or upto 10/200 (Snellen) in the better eye with best possible corrections
limitation of the field of vision subtending an angle of less than 40 degree up to 10 degree.
A permanent disability arising out of conditions such as laryngectomy or aphasia affecting one or more components of speech and language due to organic or neurological causes

A deficit in processing language, spoken or written, that may manifest itself as a difficulty to comprehend, speak, read, write, spell, or to do mathematical calculations and includes such conditions as perceptual disabilities, dyslexia, dysgraphia, dyscalculia, dyspraxia and developmental aphasia

A neuro-developmental condition typically appearing in the first three years of life that significantly affects a person's ability to communicate, understand relationships and relate to others, and is frequently associated with unusal or stereotypical rituals or behaviours

A substantial disorder of thinking, mood, perception, orientation or memory that grossly impairs judgment, behaviour, capacity to recogrise reality or ability to meet the ordinary demands oflife, but does not include retardation which is a conditon of arrested or incomplete development of mind of a person, specially characterised by subnormality of intelligence

An inflammatory, nervous system disease in which the myelin sheaths around the axons ofnerve cells ofthe brain and spinal cord are damaged, leading to demyelination and affecting the ability of nerve cells in the brain and spinal cord to communicate with each other

A progressive disease of the nervous system marked by tremor, muscular rigidity, and slow imprecise movement, chiefly affecting middle-aged and elderly people associated with degeneration of the basal ganglia of the brain and a deficiency of the neu rotransm itter dopamine

An inheritable disease, usually affecting only male but transmitted by women to their male children, characterised by loss or impairment of the normal clotting ability of blood so that a minor would may result in fatal bleeding
A group of inherited disorders characterised by reduced or absent amounts of haemoglobin
A hemolytic disorder characterised by chronic anemia, painful events, and various complications due to associated tissue and organ damage
A condition in which a person may have combination of hearing and visual impairments causing severe communication, developmental, and educational problems.

title: राष्ट्रीय सामाजिक सहायता कार्यक्रम अन्तर्गत केन्द्र प्रायोजित पेंशन योजनाओं हेतु परिक्रामी निधि के गठन एवं राज्य योजनान्तर्गत संचालित सामाजिक सुरक्षा पेंशन योजनाओं के मार्ग निर्देश में संशोधन की स्वीकृति।
